item.title: Computer Maintenance / Linux Conversions
item.description:
Why Convert an Old Computer

Sometimes a computer becomes old, and the original operating system is no longer supported or runs poorly.
That doesn‚Äôt mean the hardware is useless. In many cases, a Linux installation will bring it back to life.

What You Can Use Out of the Box

Linux provides a stable base for everyday tasks:

  • Web browsing
  • Email
  • Office-style documents and spreadsheets
  • Media playback (music, video)
  • Printing and scanning (most devices work automatically)
  • Software updates delivered through one central manager

Most of these tasks run faster and lighter on Linux than on an aging Windows or macOS installation.

item.title: Tech Repairs
item.description:
Oddball Repairs

I walk to appointments. This keeps costs low and response reliable. See Foot Soldier for Tech Maintenance.

I handle repairs within my experience: Windows and Linux systems, electronics, and a range of general devices.

  • If the problem is simple and visible on site, I‚Äôll repair it there.
  • If it needs more focus, I‚Äôll ask you to meet me at the courthouse square. Working there lets me handle it with care and concentration.
  • If a device is critical or expensive, and the fix looks uncertain, I‚Äôll stop before risking it.
  • If it can‚Äôt be repaired, I‚Äôll tell you directly. No fix, no charge.

I don‚Äôt claim to fix everything ‚Äî but if it‚Äôs in my wheelhouse, I‚Äôll give it my full attention and be honest about the outcome.

item.title: Custom Devices
item.description:
When a Custom Device Makes Sense

There may come a need where store-bought gear won‚Äôt solve a recurring problem.
That‚Äôs where small control boards, sensors, and tiny Linux computers can help‚Äîwhen a practical, local fix is better than another boxed gadget.

This is specialty work. It isn‚Äôt the cheapest path, and it shouldn‚Äôt be.
It‚Äôs for cases where downtime, waste, or repeated headaches cost more than doing it right once.

item.title: Tech Coaching

item.title: How Open-Source Saves Local Dollars and Builds Local Skill
item.description:
How Open-Source Saves Local Dollars and Builds Local Skill

See also posts/kirksville-mo-linux-guy/

Why Pay Rent on Software You Already Own?

Every month, businesses and people in Kirksville quietly pay rent on their computers.
A few bucks here for Microsoft 365, a little more for Adobe or some “cloud subscription.”
It does not sound bad – until you realize you have been paying for years… and the computer is still not yours.

item.title: Computer disaster in Kirksville! The 'Virus' That Wasn't
item.description:
Today I helped a Kirksville user who swore their system was under attack.
Three red-shield pop-ups screamed ‚ÄúSystem is infected!‚Äù ‚Äî all pointing to a domain like d3n7oed9x5adbcxsyz [dot] ows-adsguard [dot] pro.
Looks official, right? Except the domain name sounded like a cat ran across the keyboard.

After some quick sleuthing, it turned out not to be a virus at all ‚Äî but a browser notification scam.
Somewhere along the line, this website had convinced the user to ‚Äúallow notifications.‚Äù
That‚Äôs all it takes: one click of misplaced trust, and suddenly Firefox is allowed to throw fake security alerts straight to your desktop ‚Äî even when you‚Äôre not browsing.

item.title: 25 Weird and Wonderful GPU Facts
item.description:
25 Weird and Wonderful GPU Facts

GPUs: those little rectangles in your PC that quietly do most of the heavy lifting. Most people think ‚Äúgraphics card = gaming,‚Äù but these silicon beasts have some truly wild stories to tell. Here‚Äôs a mix of amazing, strange, and just plain funny GPU facts.

1. Tiny Supercomputers in Your Desk

Modern GPUs can outperform entire supercomputers from the 1990s. That old machine that mapped the human genome? Your gaming card could crush it for breakfast.

item.title: Saving Your Old Windows PC: How Linux Can Keep It Secure
item.description:
Your Old Windows PC Isn‚Äôt Getting Updates ‚Äî Why That‚Äôs a Problem

If your laptop or desktop is running Windows 7, 8, or even early Windows 10 builds, you might have noticed a quiet truth: security updates have stopped.

Life on an unsupported Windows PC can be frustrating:

  • Pop-ups warning about end-of-support
  • Applications that stop updating
  • Increased risk of malware and exploits

Maintaining it yourself means tracking CVEs and patches manually ‚Äî essentially, keeping a full-time security hobby.

item.title: Rates
item.description:
Clear and Simple Pricing

I keep rates straightforward so you know what to expect.

Service Rate
Tech Support $35 / hour
Coaching & Tutoring $20 / hour
Light Miscellaneous Labor $20 / hour
Heavy Miscellaneous Labor $35 / hour

How It Works

  • Hourly, not hidden fees ‚Äî I charge for time on the job, not surprise add-ons.
  • Family effort ‚Äî We are a team, and members of Switchboard Tech Services, LLC.
  • Tech focus first ‚Äî Most of my work is technical service and support. Non-technical labor is offered only when it makes sense and our schedule allows.
  • No fix, no charge ‚Äî If something can‚Äôt be repaired, I‚Äôll say so and you don‚Äôt pay.

Why This Matters

As a general service, I‚Äôve kept pricing simple so you can budget with confidence.
Whether it‚Äôs troubleshooting computers, teaching a system, or pitching in with local labor when help is short, the goal is practical support at clear rates.
